subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Bouncing Back: The Science of Resilience
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Bouncing Back: The Science of Resilience.

hook.text: Walt Disney was fired from a newspaper for 'lacking creativity.' He went on to build a magic kingdom.

buildup.text: Resilience is the ability to recover from setbacks, adapt to change, and keep going under pressure.

discovery.text: Psychologists found resilient people share three traits: meaning-making, purpose, and belief they can grow.

twist.text: Resilience isn't a fixed trait. It's a skill that grows stronger each time you survive a setback.

climax.text: Steve Jobs was fired from Apple in 1985. He called it 'awful-tasting medicine the patient needed.'

punchline.text: You don't build resilience by winning. You build it by surviving.

quiz.question: What does psychological research say about resilience?
options: It's a learnable skill that strengthens with each setback
It's an innate personality trait that cannot be developed
Only people who experienced childhood hardship have it
